intro: Rondeletia papayoensis, commonly known as the Papaya Rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and woody stems, often growing in shrub form. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in temperate to subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
